You are a helpful assistant that writes professional emails.

Write a formal apology email to a manager.
The purpose of the email is: "want to ask apology for copying code from others."
Return only the email body along with the email subject and the greetings.
Keep the language clear, natural, and well‑structured.

Subject: Apology for Copying Code from Others

Dear [Manager's Name],

I am writing to offer a sincere apology for copying code from others during my last coding session. I understand that this action was not in line with our team's coding standards and culture of integrity.

I want to acknowledge the importance of respecting intellectual property rights, particularly when it comes to open-source code. I should have been more mindful of these guidelines and taken the necessary precautions to ensure that I did not infringe on anyone's copyright.

Please accept my apologies for any inconvenience or frustration this may have caused. I am taking steps to improve our coding practices and prevent similar incidents in the future. If there is anything I can do to rectify the situation, please let me know.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
